questionsData.title: The particles in gases move slowly.
Loudness is measured on (pH) scale.
The moon is the only natural satellite of the earth.
City and countryside are antonyms.
Tigers and lions are of the cat family.
"along the shore" is "the coastline".
The highest part of a mountain is its beak.
"lost my hold on" means "could no longer hold".
The mountain with a hole in the top is a hurricane.
Rescue teams are people who rescue people in danger.
Richter scale usually measures the number of dead people.
When you accept advice, you say "that’s a good idea".
A project manager manages projects.
"adult education" means "kids education".
"necessary information" is used when filling an application form.
A table spoon and tea spoon are the same size.
"endless" means "it has an end".
"buy" and "sell" are antonyms.
Deck is the back of the ship.
"it's obvious" means "it is not clear".
The text is mainly talking about ………
questionsData.article:
Camels are large mammals that live and work in several deserts. They are known for their humps. The
Arabian camel, or dromedary, has one hump on its back. The Bactrian or Asian camel has two humps. The
Bactrian camel lives in the highlands of central Asia. The Arabian camel lives mainly in north Africa, the middle
east, and India. Camels weigh up to 650 kilograms. They are about 2 meters tall, at the hump. The hump is made
of fat and muscles. Camels have long necks, small heads, split upper lips and long eyelashes which (protect 1) the
eyes from sandstorms and glaring sun. Camels feed on thorny plants, shrubs and (dried 2) grasses. They can stay
for days or even months, without water. If a camel goes without food and water, the fat in its hump can nourish it
for several days. Camels can carry up to 450 kilograms. Desert people also drink the camel's milk and eat (its 3)
meat. Dried camel droppings are useful as fuel for cooking fires
